text: Compresses an OpenVDB sequence and caches it to disk as a single file.
This node compresses an OpenVDB sequence to disk into a single
file. This drastically reduces the memory footprints of cached volumetric data, enables faster viewport playback in Houdini through the
Currently, ZibraVDB does not compress VDB sequences containing vector fields/channels, such as Color (
), etc. You can bypass this limitation by spliting and renaming your vector fields to float fields. Up to 8 float fields/channels can be compressed at once.
Vector VDB compression will be supported in the future.
is a VDB compression and real-time playback technology developed by

. It can achieve approximately 30~100 times cache size reduction with minimal quality loss, with even higher compression rates planned for future updates. The proprietary output file format, .zibravdb, captures an entire VDB sequence in a single file, which can be loaded back into an application (such as Houdini or Unreal Engine), decompressed on the GPU in real time, and played back in the viewport at speeds multiple times faster than native solutions.

What ZibraVDB brings is a memory-efficient, high-performance volumetric data pipeline that seamlessly integrates into artists' existing, familiar workflows. It significantly reduces storage costs, improves volumetric data I/O speed, and ultimately makes it easier and more feasible to share working projects and distribute final products with high-quality volumetric effects.

is an open-source plugin contributed by Zibra AI to SideFX Labs. This plugin allows ZibraVDB’s compression, decompression, and fast playback capabilities to integrate smoothly into Houdini’s native volumetric workflows.
The compressed output can also be used directly with

, enabling artists to create beautiful, high-fidelity volumetric effects in Houdini, and render them efficiently as 3D ray-marched volumes in real-time environments for virtual productions or video games.
To start using ZibraVDB for Houdini you need to get license key and activate it.
You can get license key using
Open houdini.env file in Houdini’s Documents folder
file and paste your license key in it. The file can be located anywhere.

to the end of the file.
Now the plugin should be activated.
When first using any ZibraVDB node you need to download core library. This needs to be done only once.
button on this or any other ZibraVDB node.
A pop-up window will appear confirming successful download.

file and saves it to disk in background.
Opens the control dialog to allow adjustments of the render parameters before rendering.
Specifies whether to compress VDB in the frame range or a single frame.
Specifies the range of frames to render (start frame, end frame, and increment). All values may be floating point values. The range is inclusive.
Uses the settings in a particular take while rendering. Choose Current to use the current take when rendering.
The path to the SOP node with the VDB data to compress.
file VDB sequence will be compessed to. The node automatically creates missing directories in the path.
Specifies quality of the compressed effect. The lower quality is the higher compression rate will be.
Allows to specify different compression quality for each channel.
Allows to specify number of overrides for compression quality per channel. Not specified channels will use value from
Name of the channel that will have custom compression settings.
Specifies compression Quality for the specific channel.
Run this script before any rendering.
Run this script before each frame.
Run this script after each frame.
Run this script after all rendering.
Downloads the core library for ZibraVDB. You need to press this button when using ZibraVDB for the first time.

title: Labs ZibraVDB Compress (Alpha)
summary: Compresses an OpenVDB sequence and caches it to disk as a single file.
